# Regression tree
```{r}
# Use caret for model comparison 
ctrl <- trainControl(method = "cv")
set.seed(1)
# Use CP from above pruned model, cp is complexity parameter
rpart.fit <- train(weekly_sales~., df_1percent, 
                   method = "rpart",
                   tuneGrid = data.frame(cp = exp(seq(-10,0, length = 50))),
                   trControl = ctrl)
plot(rpart.fit, xTrans = function(x)log(x))

```
# Pruned tree
```{r}
rpart.fit.trim <- train(weekly_sales~., df_1percent, 
                   method = "rpart",
                   tuneGrid = data.frame(cp = exp(seq(-10,0, length = 50))),
                   trControl = trainControl(
                                method = "cv",
                                selectionFunction = "oneSE"))
plot(rpart.fit.trim, xTrans = function(x)log(x))
```
```{r}
rpart.plot(rpart.fit.trim$finalModel)
```
# bagging 
```{r}
ctrl <- trainControl(method = "cv")
set.seed(1)
bg.fit <- train(weekly_sales ~ ., 
                df_1percent,
                method = "ranger",
                tuneGrid = expand.grid(
                          mtry = 12, 
                          splitrule = "variance",
                          min.node.size = 1 ),
                importance = "permutation",
                scale.permutation.importance = "TRUE",
                trControl = ctrl
              )

# plot variable of importance 
barplot(sort(ranger::importance(bg.fit$finalModel), decreasing = FALSE),
        las = 2, horiz = TRUE, cex.names = 0.7)
```
```{r}
ggplot(bg.fit, highlight = TRUE)
```
#randome forest 
```{r}
ctrl <- trainControl(method = "cv")
rf.grid <- expand.grid(mtry = 1:12,
                       splitrule = "variance",
                       min.node.size = 1:4)
set.seed(1)
rf.fit <- train(weekly_sales~., df_1percent,
                method = "ranger",
                tuneGrid = rf.grid,
                trControl = ctrl)

#rf.fit$bestTune
ggplot(rf.fit, highlight = TRUE)
```
# boosting 
```{r}
gbm.grid <- expand.grid(n.trees = c(1500,2200,900),
                        interaction.depth = c(5,7,9,11,13),
                        shrinkage = c(0.15,0.1,0.05),
                        n.minobsinnode = 1)
set.seed(1)
gbm.fit <- train(weekly_sales~., df_1percent,
                 method = "gbm",
                 tuneGrid = gbm.grid,
                 trControl = ctrl,
                 verbose = FALSE)

#ggplot(gbm.fit, highlight = TRUE)
#varImp(gbm.fit) %>% plot()
#summary(gbm.fit$finalModel)
```


#resample 
```{r}
resamp <- resamples(list(reg_tree = rpart.fit, 
                         sm_reg_tree = rpart.fit.trim
                         ,bagging = bg.fit
                          ,rf = rf.fit
                         ,gbm = gbm.fit
                         ))
summary(resamp)
bwplot(resamp, metric = "RMSE")
```
